title: Greens–European Free Alliance
text:
The Greens/European Free Alliance (Greens/EFA) is a <a href="political%20group%20of%20the%20European%20Parliament">political group of the European Parliament</a> composed primarily of <a href="Green%20politics">green</a> and <a href="Regionalism%20%28politics%29">regionalist</a> political parties.
Formed following the <a href="1999%20European%20Parliament%20election">1999 European elections</a> for the <a href="Fifth%20European%20Parliament">5th European Parliament</a>, the Greens/EFA group now consists of five distinct <a href="European%20political%20party">European political parties</a>, namely the larger <a href="European%20Green%20Party">European Green Party</a> (EGP) and part of the <a href="European%20Free%20Alliance">European Free Alliance</a> (EFA) and the smaller <a href="European%20Pirate%20Party">European Pirate Party</a> (PPEU), <a href="Volt%20Europa">Volt Europa</a> (Volt), and part of <a href="Animal%20Politics%20EU">Animal Politics EU</a> (APEU). The EFA consists of parties representing <a href="stateless%20nations">stateless nations</a>, regionalist and <a href="Political%20parties%20of%20minorities">minority political</a> interests. The group has generally limited its membership to <a href="Progressivism">progressive</a> parties. These European parties are joined by MEPs from non-aligned national parties, which have included the Dutch <a href="Europe%20Transparent">Europe Transparent</a> (2004–2009) and the <a href="Pirate%20Party%20%28Sweden%29">Swedish</a> (2009–2014), <a href="Pirate%20Party%20Germany">German</a> (2014–) and <a href="Czech%20Pirate%20Party">Czech</a> (2019–) <a href="Pirate%20Party">Pirate Parties</a>.
Group presidents.
The Greens/EFA group is usually co-chaired by 2 presidents, at least one of them must be a woman.
